greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 3-adic valuation of binomial(2*n, n): largest k such that 3^k divides binomial(2*n, n).
comment: a(n) = 0 if and only if n is in A005836. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 19 2013
sign(a(n+1) - a(n)) is repeat [0, 1, -1]. - _Filip Zaludek_, Oct 29 2016
By Kummer's theorem, number of carries when adding n + n in base 3. - _Robert Israel_, Oct 30 2016
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
Michael Gilleland, Some Self-Similar Integer Sequences.
E. E. Kummer, Über die Ergänzungssätze zu den allgemeinen Reciprocitätsgesetzen, Journal für die reine und angewandte Mathematik, Vol. 44 (1852), pp. 93-146; alternative link.
Dorel Miheţ, Legendre's and Kummer's theorems again, Resonance, Vol. 15, No. 12 (2010), pp. 1111-1121; alternative link.
Armin Straub, Victor H. Moll and Tewodros Amdeberhan, The p-adic valuation of k-central binomial coefficients, Acta Arithmetica, Vol. 140, No. 1 (2009), pp. 31-42.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k>=0} floor(2*n/3^k) - 2*Sum_{k>=0} floor(n/3^k). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 26 2003
maple: f:= proc(n) option remember; local k,m,d;
mathematica: p=3; Array[ If[ Mod[ bi=Binomial[ 2#, # ], p ]==0, Select[ FactorInteger[ bi ], Function[ q, q[ [ 1 ] ]==p ], 1 ][ [ 1, 2 ] ], 0 ]&, 27*3, 0 ]
Table[ IntegerExponent[ Binomial[2 n, n], 3], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 15 2016 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _R. K. Guy_
